reviews.text:
Filling up on my food expenditions over the past few years, stumbled upon this gem after going to Mountbatten for a carousell deal. This was an amazing place ran by a rather handsome dark skinned guy with alluring eyes. He prepared my briyani immediately, nothing was cold, everything was warm and cooked to perfection. The rice was fluffy, the chicken was tender, the curry had great viscosity, very flavourful and fitting for the aromatic briyani rice.

The downside is this stall is located at the back of the hawker centre. Though there are nets to protect consumers from the birds and weather, some birds flock around the tables, which made me quite afraid they would poop or eat my plate if I was not attentive.

The Beef Nihari was fabulous.  Chicken Sheekh Kabab was quite decent. They had ran out of the Shami Kabab unfortunately,  had to leave the place without trying it out.

The indian guy at the store was very helpful and friendly going out of his way to make us feel welcomed at the restaurant.

All in all, loved my dining experience!

Authentic Mughlai, North Indian Food
Nothing comparable in Singapore. Felt like I am in New Delhi. Amazing preparation and very friendly host/ Owner. He is a true lover of Mughlai food and loves to pamper his guests. A must visit place. Don‚Äôt miss it‚Ä¶! üëåüëåüèÜüèÜ
the rice look lighter in color tone and lighter in taste when compare with the picture on the menu. the chicken are really very little - only two small pieces. overall it is considered expensive
The food is very authentic mughlai. Nahari was awesome. Qorma & shami kabab are a must try. Aloo gosht was delicious. Good for party orders.
